source.dfe7f812:
def bar_plot(variable):
    var = vg_df[variable]
    
    varValue = var.value_counts()
    
    varValue = var.value_counts()
    
    plt.figure(figsize=(30,10))
    plt.bar(varValue.index,varValue)
    plt.xticks(varValue.index,varValue.index.values)
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.title(variable)
    plt.show()
    print("{}: \n {}".format(variable,varValue))
source.38331159:
def hist_plot(variable):
    plt.figure(figsize=(30,10))
    plt.hist(vg_df[variable],bins=100)
    plt.xlabel(variable)
    plt.ylabel("Frequency")
    plt.title("{}\n disrubition with list".format(variable))
source.07832b78:
def detect_outliers(vg_df,features):
    outlier_indices = []
    
    for c in features:
        # 1st quartile
        Q1 = np.percentile(vg_df[c],25)
        # 3rd quartile
        Q3 = np.percentile(vg_df[c],75)
        # IQR
        IQR = Q3 - Q1
        # Outlier step
        outlier_step = IQR * 1.5
        # detect outlier and their indeces
        outlier_list_col = vg_df[(vg_df[c] < Q1 - outlier_step) | (vg_df[c] > Q3 + outlier_step)].index
        # store indeces
        outlier_indices.extend(outlier_list_col)
    
    outlier_indices = Counter(outlier_indices)
    multiple_outliers = list(i for i, v in outlier_indices.items() if v > 2)
    
    return multiple_outliers
source.5a4e42de:
genre_list=list(vg_df["Genre"].unique())
NA_Sales1 = []      
EU_Sales1 = []    
JP_Sales1 = []     
Other_Sales1 = []  
Global_Sales1 = []
for i in genre_list:
    x = vg_df[vg_df["Genre"]==i]
    NA_Sales1.append(sum(x.NA_Sales)/len(x))     
    EU_Sales1.append(sum(x.EU_Sales)/len(x))  
    JP_Sales1.append(sum(x.JP_Sales)/len(x)) 
    Other_Sales1.append(sum(x.Other_Sales)/len(x)) 
    Global_Sales1.append(sum(x.Global_Sales)/len(x))
    
#visualization
f,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(9,12))
sns.barplot(x=NA_Sales1,y=genre_list,color="blue",alpha=0.5,label="NA Sales")
sns.barplot(x=EU_Sales1,y=genre_list,color="purple",alpha=0.6,label="EU Sales")
sns.barplot(x=JP_Sales1,y=genre_list,color="red",alpha=0.7,label="JP Sales")
sns.barplot(x=Other_Sales1,y=genre_list,color="yellow",alpha=0.8,label="Other Sales")
sns.barplot(x=Global_Sales1,y=genre_list,color="green",alpha=0.4,label="Global Sales")

ax.legend(loc="lower right",frameon=True)
ax.set(xlabel="Rates of Sales",ylabel="Games of Genre",title="Sales Rates of Game Genres in The Region")
plt.show()

year_list=list(vg_df["Year"].unique())
NA_Sales2 = []      
EU_Sales2 = []    
JP_Sales2 = []     
Other_Sales2 = []  
Global_Sales2 = []
for i in year_list:
    x=vg_df[vg_df["Year"]==i]
    NA_Sales2.append(sum(x.NA_Sales)/len(x))     
    EU_Sales2.append(sum(x.EU_Sales)/len(x))  
    JP_Sales2.append(sum(x.JP_Sales)/len(x)) 
    Other_Sales2.append(sum(x.Other_Sales)/len(x)) 
    Global_Sales2.append(sum(x.Global_Sales)/len(x))
    
f,ax1=plt.subplots(figsize=(25,15))
sns.pointplot(x=year_list,y=NA_Sales2,color="blue",alpha=0.5)
sns.pointplot(x=year_list,y=EU_Sales2,color="red",alpha=0.6)
sns.pointplot(x=year_list,y=JP_Sales2,color="yellow",alpha=0.7)
sns.pointplot(x=year_list,y=Other_Sales2,color="green",alpha=0.8)
sns.pointplot(x=year_list,y=Global_Sales2,color="purple",alpha=0.4)
plt.text(40,0.90,'NA_Sales',color='blue',fontsize = 17,style = 'italic')
plt.text(40,0.80,'EU_Sales',color='red',fontsize = 17,style = 'italic')
plt.text(40,0.70,'JP_Sales',color='yellow',fontsize = 17,style = 'italic')
plt.text(40,0.60,'Other_Sales',color='green',fontsize = 17,style = 'italic')
plt.text(40,0.50,'Global',color='purple',fontsize = 17,style = 'italic')
plt.xlabel('Year',fontsize = 30,color='black')
plt.ylabel('Sales',fontsize = 30,color='black')
plt.title('Sales Rates in The Region by Years',fontsize = 40,color='black')
plt.grid()

labels=vg_df.Genre.value_counts().index
colors=["grey","blue","red","yellow","green","brown","turquoise","orange","purple","cyan","maroon","pink"]

sizes=vg_df.Genre.value_counts()

plt.figure(figsize=(12,12))

* int64(1): Rank
* float64(6): Year, NA_Sales, EU_Sales, JP_Sales, Other_Sales, Global_Sales
* Object(4): Name, Platform, Genre, Publisher
source.88f852a6: # **2.Variable Description** * Rank : Game numbers * Name : Name * Platform : Games platform (ex: ps4,pc etc.) * Year : Games release date * Genre : Games kind * Publisher : Developer games * NA_Sales : The game of sales in North America * EU_Sales : The game of sales in Europe * JP_Sales : The game of sales in Japan * Other_Sales : The game of sales Other * Global_Sales : The game of sales in Global
source.361f6d53: ## **Univariate Variable Analysis** * Categorical Veriable: Name, Platform, Year, Genre, Publisher * Numerical Veriable: NA_Sales, EU_Sales, JP_Sales, Other_Sales, Global_Sales
source.222a2ce9: # **3.Basic Data Analysis** * Genre vs NA_Sales * Genre vs EU_Sales * Genre vs JP_Sales * Genre vs Other_Sales * Genre vs Global_Sales * Platform vs Global_Sales * Year vs Global_Sales
